name: Hardest The Fantastic Four (Volume 1) - The Latter Years Trivia Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 'Fantastic Four' #167 (1976) the Thing loses his powers and reverts to being human Ben Grimm.  For legal reasons the team has to have four powered members, so who does Mr. Fantastic hire as his replacement?
questions.explanation:
Luke Cage (Power Man).

	Luke Cage, the Hero for Hire is extended paid membership, but it is extremely short lived.  Three issues in fact.  Reed design's a exo-suit for Ben that mimics the appearance of his Thing persona.  This allows Ben to return to active duty.

questions.text: In order to keep their son safe as they continued operating with the Fantastic Four, who did Reed and Sue hire as a nanny to watch over their son Franklin?
questions.explanation:
Agatha Harkness.

	Agatha was a powerful witch with an elderly appearance.  She became a recurring character after Franklin's birth and appeared semi-regularly through 1980.

questions.text: The Human Torch dated a red-headed translator for the United Nations for several years.  In 1982 she discovered she had powers similar to his.  She came close to turning the Fantastic Four into the Fantastic Five.  What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Frankie Raye.

	It turned out she was the step-daughter of the man who created the original Human Torch android.  The team was ready to go from 4 to 5, but then Frankie became a new herald for Galactus.  Henceforth she would go by the name Nova.

questions.text: Since the first days of the Fantastic Four, the Thing was always referencing one of his aunts.  Twenty years later she finally saw print!  What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Aunt Petunia.

	Ben would quote Aunt Petunia, claim to be "Aunt Petunia's favorite nephew" and declare, "by the love of my Aunt Petunia"!  Readers and the other members of the Fantastic Four were extremely surprised to discover she was very young!

questions.text: After the events of the first 'Secret Wars' mini-series, Ben opts to leave the Fantastic Four (he was given his own self-titled series).  Who does Ben hand select as his replacement on the team (1984)?
questions.explanation:
She-Hulk.

	Jessica (She-Hulk) Walters joins the team in 'Fantastic Four' #265 (April 1984) and her membership would last almost three years.

questions.text: Unbeknownst to anyone in the Fantastic Four, Alicia (the Thing's longtime girlfriend) was replaced for several years by a Skrull.  As Alicia, this Skrull began dating the Human Torch and ultimately revealed herself.  What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Lyja.

	After years of masquerading as Alicia, Lyja revealed herself in 'Fantastic Four' #357 (1991).  She would gain the trust of the team and continue dating the Human Torch.  Lyja remained a regular cast member and even served as a member of the Fantastic Four in future volumes.

questions.text: Severely depressed after her second pregnancy ends in stillbirth, the Invisible Girl is manipulated by the Psycho-Man into becoming a new persona.  She then attacks her fellow Fantastic Four members.  What was the name of this persona?
questions.explanation:
Malice.

	After Sue fights for her very soul, and finally breaks free of the Psycho-Man's control, she expresses her new found independence by changing her code name to the Invisible Woman.

questions.text: After several years off the team, Thing returns to the Fantastic Four (1986).  With Thing back, Mr. Fantastic and the Invisible Woman decide to take a hiatus to spend more time with their son.  Who replaces them on the team?
questions.explanation:
Crystal and Ms. Marvel

	Ms. Marvel (Sharon Ventura) is soon exposed to cosmic rays and is transformed into a female version of the Thing called She-Thing.  Reed and Sue would return to the team in 1989.

questions.text: In 'Fantastic Four' #381 (1993), Mr. Fantastic is believed to have been killed.  Sue takes over leadership of the team.  Who does she recruit to fill his place and act as a technical adviser?
questions.explanation:
Ant-Man.

	Ant-Man (Scott Lang) would remain through this volumes last issues.  He would appear again as a member of the Fantastic Four, and as its leader, in some of the team's subsequent volumes of publication.

questions.text: On numerous occasions, according to Mr. Fantastic and the Fantastic Four's greatest enemy, Dr. Doom, which member of the team is most powerful?
questions.explanation:
Invisible Woman.

	Sue is continually learning new ways to employ her powers, especially the invisible force fields she can wield.  She can use them as barriers or a weapon.
